DK8472N_syn_1:
Proc: Nav Bronch RLL.
Target: 22mm solid nodule.
Nav: EMN + Radial EBUS.
Samples: TBNA x3, Bx x4, Brush x2.
Complication: 10% Pneumothorax.
Plan: Conservative management.
DK8472N_syn_2:
PROCEDURE NOTE: Electromagnetic Navigation Bronchoscopy.
INDICATION: 2.2 cm RLL nodule.
PROCEDURE: The target in the RLL superior segment was localized using electromagnetic navigation. Radial EBUS confirmed concentric visualization. Sampling was performed via needle, forceps, and brush. Post-procedure imaging revealed a small apical pneumothorax which did not require intervention. The patient was monitored and discharged stable.
DK8472N_syn_3:
CPT Justification:
- 31627: EMN used.
- 31654: Radial EBUS used.
- 31629: TBNA.
- 31623: Brush.
- 31628: Biopsy.
Complication: Pneumothorax (ICD-10 J93.9), conservative management.

DK8472N_syn_5: nav bronch [REDACTED]... rll nodule... took a while to find it had to reposition... eventually got concentric view... took all the samples... patient got a small pneumothorax about 10 percent... watched her for 4 hours she was fine... discharged.
DK8472N_syn_6: Indication: Peripheral RLL nodule 22mm, solid, bronchus sign present on thin-cut CT. Navigation Protocol: Guide sheath advanced under combined EM navigation + fluoroscopic guidance. Tool-in-lesion NOT initially confirmed - repositioned ×2. Final radial probe position showed concentric EBUS pattern. Sampling: Aspiration needle ×3, Forceps biopsies ×4, Brush cytology ×2. Post-procedure CXR: Small apical pneumothorax ~10%, patient asymptomatic. Conservative management.
DK8472N_syn_7:
[Indication]
22mm RLL nodule.
[Anesthesia]
Moderate Sedation.
[Description]
Navigated to RLL. Radial EBUS confirmed concentric view. TBNA, Bx, Brush performed. Small PTX noted post-op.
[Plan]
Observe and Discharge.
DK8472N_syn_8: Jennifer underwent a navigation procedure for a nodule in her right lower lung. It took a couple of tries to align the catheter perfectly, but we eventually got a good ultrasound view. We took multiple samples. Afterward, the x-ray showed a small lung collapse (pneumothorax), but it was minor enough that she didn't need a chest tube and went home after a few hours of monitoring.
DK8472N_syn_9:
Procedure: Guided bronchoscopic biopsy.
Target: Right Lower Lobe solid lesion.
Complication: Iatrogenic pneumothorax (minor).
Action: Localized lesion via EMN and REBUS. Sampled via needle, forceps, and brush. 
Disposition: Observation.
DK8472N:
Patient: [REDACTED] | MR# [REDACTED] | Birth Date: [REDACTED]

Indication → Peripheral RLL nodule 22mm, solid, bronchus sign present on thin-cut CT

Pre-procedure: Risk discussed including pneumothorax (3-5%), bleeding, nondiagnostic result

Sedation → Moderate: Versed 3mg IV, Fentanyl 75mcg IV
Patient [REDACTED] verbal commands, Ramsay 2-3
Monitoring: continuous SpO2, BP every 10 minutes

Navigation Protocol:
1. CT-to-body registration completed with electromagnetic system
2. Virtual pathway planned to RLL superior segment
3. Guide sheath advanced under combined EM navigation + fluoroscopic guidance
4. Tool-in-lesion NOT initially confirmed - repositioned ×2
5. Final radial probe position showed concentric EBUS pattern ✓
6. Fluoro time: 6.8 minutes (longer due to repositioning)
7. Dose area product: 245 cGy*cm²

Sampling:
- Aspiration needle ×3
- Forceps biopsies ×4
- Brush cytology ×2

Protocol adherence: Yes - all planned sampling techniques utilized

Post-procedure CXR: Small apical pneumothorax ~10%, patient asymptomatic
Conservative management, observation ×4 hours, repeat CXR stable, discharged

Complications: Mild pneumothorax (no intervention required)
